Capture the Flag Training

In short, Capture the Flag (CTF) is a computer security exercise where there is a "Flag" secretly hidden within a purposely vulnerable program or website. The objective is to steal the flag from other competitors in an attack/defense style CTF or from the organizors in a jeopardy-style challenge.

CTF competitions are a fun way to advance, challenge, and prove your cybersecurity skills. You can compete individualy or as a team. CTF problems are asked in job interviews to test the skills of professionals. So, competing in CTF competitions may prepare you for cybersecurity job interviews as well.

For a more detailed explanation, with examples, watch this video below to go deeper into what CTF Challenges are and what one may experience when trying to complete an excercise.


CTF Training Links

There are numerous places you can visit for Capture the Flag training. A very popular one that we like to use is HACKTHEBOX. Here you can start your CTF training or just jump straight in to some of the more skillful challenges. Below is a list of links to Capture the flag training sites, some of which are made by our own Cyberknights.

  • OverTheWire
  • CTFLEARN
  • HackThisSite.org
  • MicroCorruption
  • Tyler Rasmussen's CTF Challenge
  • Hacksplaining
  • TryHackMe Basic Pentesting
  • HackTheBox Starting Point
  • OverTheWire Bandit Series
  • CryptoHack Crypto on the Web
  • Pico CTF
  • CTF Academy Network Forensics

If you would like to go past reading about CTF Challenges, here is a quick video to reference for some of the best Beginner to Intermediate CTF Challenges to get started!
